com.capgemini.cobigen.api.extension

Interface TriggerInterpreter


  • public interface TriggerInterpreter
    This interface should be inherited by implementations to cover the interpretation of new trigger types. Therefore you have to provide exactly one InputReader and one MatcherInterpreter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      InputReader getInputReader()
      This function should return the InputReader for reading the intended input format for this trigger interpreter
      MatcherInterpreter getMatcher()
      This function should return the MatcherInterpreter for matching a given input as a valid input to be processed and resolving the values of all variable assignments
      String getType()
      This function should return the type name, which could be declared in the type parameter of the XML <trigger> element and therefore invoke this interpreter

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        String getType()
        This function should return the type name, which could be declared in the type parameter of the XML <trigger> element and therefore invoke this interpreter
        Returns:
        the type name (not null)

      • getMatcher

        MatcherInterpreter getMatcher()
        This function should return the MatcherInterpreter for matching a given input as a valid input to be processed and resolving the values of all variable assignments
        Returns:
        the MatcherInterpreter (not null)
